meanings.definition: Lack of good manners or proper behavior.
meanings.sent1: His impolicies at the dinner table embarrassed everyone.
meanings.sent2: Her impolicies at the party made others uncomfortable.
meanings.sent3: Despite his impolicies, he always tried to be polite.
meanings.sent4: The impolicies of the guests were like a storm in a teacup.
meanings.sent5: The teacher addressed the impolicies in the classroom immediately.

meanings.definition: A breach of etiquette or social norms.
meanings.sent1: The impolicies of the guest disrupted the event.
meanings.sent2: She was shocked by the impolicies displayed at the formal gathering.
meanings.sent3: The impolicies of the cat knocking over the vase were forgiven.
meanings.sent4: The impolicies of the driver on the road were dangerous.
meanings.sent5: The impolicies of the children running wild were hard to ignore.
